alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:49PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hitchcock and northeastern Dundy Counties through 315 PM MDT/415 PM CDT/... At 249 PM MDT/349 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Stratton, or 8 miles west of Trenton, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Hitchcock and northeastern Dundy Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
